items.headline: Berkshire’s stock presents Warren Buffett with a ‘golden cross’ as his retirement nears
items.summary_en: Shares of Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway have produced a bullish “golden cross” chart pattern, less than three months before the famed investor is set to retire.

items.headline: The U.S. jobs market was wobbling before the shutdown. Now what?
items.summary_en: The U.S. labor market had started to sputter well before the government shutdown began in October — and there’s little evidence to suggest finding a job has gotten any easier.

items.headline: Barclays takes a victory lap over lack of First Brands exposure. But it did get burned on Tricolor.
items.summary_en: The CEO of Barclays said the bank wasn’t stuck with exposure to fallen auto-parts company First Brands because of its own due diligence, but it was lumbered with Tricolor exposure.

items.headline: ‘Fingers crossed’ is not what investors want to hear as L’Oreal shares get slammed

items.headline: Here’s when the shutdown will really hurt the quality of key reports like CPI and the unemployment rate
items.summary_en: The longer the U.S. government shutdown, the trickier it will get for the Labor Department to publish key reports, even were it to get White House approval to do so.
